title: Enrique V. Iglesias | Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean

quotes: Enrique V. Iglesias, who is Uruguayan, was born in Asturias, Spain, in 1930
he graduated with a degree in economics and administration from the University of Montevideo in 1953
From 1961 to 1969, as Technical Director of Uruguay's National Planning Office, he was in charge of preparing that country's First National Plan for Economic and Social Development.
From 1967 to 1969, as President of Uruguay's Central Bank, he headed several missions at the national and international level, on behalf of his government.

From 1964 to 1967 he was also Uruguay's delegate to the Conferences of the Asociación Latinoamericana de Libre Comercio (Latin American Free Trade Association, ALALC) and the Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean
He sat on the ILPES Board of Directors from 1965 on, serving as President of this body from 1967 to 1972 and Interim Director from 1977 to 1978.
He sat on the ILPES Board of Directors from 1965 on, serving as President of this body from 1967 to 1972 and Interim Director from 1977 to 1978.
He sat on the ILPES Board of Directors from 1965 on, serving as President of this body from 1967 to 1972 and Interim Director from 1977 to 1978.

In 1968 he headed the experts group that worked with Dr. Raúl Prebisch to prepare a broad study on economic conditions in Latin America, under the auspices of the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB)
In 1970, he went on to head a planning advisory group with the CORDIPLAN office of the Government of Venezuela.
He was appointed ECLAC Executive Secretary on 27 March 1972, a post he held until February 1985
He was appointed ECLAC Executive Secretary on 27 March 1972, a post he held until February 1985

quotes: he graduated with a degree in economics and administration from the University of Montevideo in 1953.
In the academic field, he has been full professor of Economic Development at the University of Montevideo and Director of the Economics Institute at that university.
